snippet: The cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church moved deliberately on Tuesday toward the selection of a new pope following the resignation of Benedict XVI.
abstract: Cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church, despite intense anticipation, move deliberately toward the selection of a new pope following the resignation of Benedict XVI; some Vatican experts say slow pace could benefit candidates from outside Italy who may be intent on cleaning up widely reported instances of corruption within the Vatican bureaucracy.
lead_paragraph: The cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church moved deliberately on Tuesday toward the selection of a new pope following the resignation of Benedict XVI.

headline.seo: Cardinals Move Toward Selection of New Pope
headline.main: Cardinals Signal Careful Pace Toward Vote on Pope
headline.print_headline: Cardinals Signal Careful Pace Toward Vote on Pope
